articles.author: Ruqaiya Beguwala
articles.description:
Introduction


Git is a powerful version control system that helps developers manage code changes efficiently. One of its useful features is the ability to revert commits---undoing changes from previous commits. TheÂ git revertÂ command is commonly used for this, but theÂ --no-commitÂ flag adds extra flexibility, especially when reverting multiple commits.
In this guide, we'll exploreÂ git revert --no-commitÂ for beginners, intermediate, and advanced users, with practical examples at each level.
git revert



  
  
  What isÂ git revert?


git revertÂ creates a new commit that undoes the changes from a previous commit. UnlikeÂ git reset, it doesn't delete history---making it safe for shared repositories.
git revert <commit-hash>

This creates a new commit that reverses the changes fromÂ <commit-hashâ€¦
articles.title: Day 17/30 - Git Revert --no-commit: Revert Multiple Commits Without Auto-Committing

articles.author: SnykSec
articles.description:
Today marks a significant milestone for Snyk and, more importantly, for the security posture of the U.S. government. I'm thrilled to introduce Snyk for Government, our FedRAMP Moderate authorized solution for the public sector.Â Â 
This authorization underscores our unwavering commitment to providing secure development solutions that meet the rigorous standards of the Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP). It means that U.S. government agencies can now confidently leverage Snyk's comprehensive platform to identify and remediate vulnerabilities throughout their software development lifecycle, knowing it meets the stringent security and compliance requirements mandated by the federal government.
This achievement is not just a certification; it's a testament to our dedicatâ€¦
articles.title: Snyk for Government Achieves FedRAMP Moderate Authorization: A Milestone for Secure Government Software

articles.author: thankamatho
articles.description:
Project Idea


I am building an AI Pathfinder World Builder / Campaign Manager
Map Creator
Lore / History Editor (Including Item Creation)
NPC Creator w/ Agentic Capabilities
Pathfinder MCP tool
Pathfinder Rules Integration
AI GM based on the MCP tools and Rules Integration to Run Campaigns
ElevenLabs integration with the GM / NPCs
One more surprise feature base on Agentic Capabilities
I prefer UI/UX first design. That doesn't mean I don't plan out architecture for the backend services, but I prefer UI/UX first design because it helps shape what the backend services should even be. I look at a problem and think about what pain points various features would have, design and test them, and then figure out how to reduce or eliminate those pain points. Sometimes this means fundamental changes in the platform. That is why I feel like ironing out the UI/UX and seeing what backend services that would entail is optimal at least for me.
Was going to be StoryForge; I misspelled the Domain Name on registration.
I am excited for the Claude4 integration announcement
Heads up: Plans and Posts will get more technical as the hackathon moves on
Finish UI for Maps, Lore, and Characters


Setup initial AI chat


Add initial AI features to Maps, Lore, and Characters
articles.title: Bolt Hackathon Day 8/30: Week 1 Post Mortem & Week 2 Plans

articles.author: SameX
articles.description:
In HarmonyOS Next development, the performance of enum types (enum) is crucial to resource-constrained devices (such as IoT terminals, embedded devices).The enumeration of Cangjie language achieves a balance between memory usage and matching efficiency through constructor design, matching order optimization and compiler characteristics.This article combines document knowledge points to analyze the performance optimization strategies of enumeration types.
The parameterless enumeration takes up 1 byte in memory and is used to store the constructor index.For example:
enum SimpleState { | Idle | Running | Stopped } // Takes up 1 byte

The compiler assigns a unique index to each constructor (such as Idle=0, Running=1, Stopped=2) to quickly access the state through the index.
The memory usage ofâ€¦
articles.title: HarmonyOS Next enumeration type performance optimization: memory and matching efficiency

articles.author: SameX
articles.description:
In HarmonyOS Next development, state machines are an effective tool for managing complex business logic.Combining enum types (enum) and pattern matching (match), states can be clearly defined, standardized state migration, and ensure type safety.This article takes scenarios such as smart home device control and network request process as examples to analyze how to build a robust state machine through enumeration and pattern matching.
Using enumeration to enumerate all possible states of a state machine, the constructor can carry parameters to represent state properties.
// Smart home equipment state machine
enum DeviceState {
| Off // Shutdown status
| On(Int) // Power-on status (carrying the current brightness)
| Error(String) // Error status (carrying error message)
| Update(progress: Inâ€¦
articles.title: HarmonyOS Next Enumeration and Pattern Matching in State Machines

articles.author: Utkarsh Rastogi
articles.description:
A heartwarming tale of how a small chaiwala from Cloud Nagar became the face of serverless computing!

With added masala, mazaa, and maximum gyaan on how AWS Lambda works internally!
Once upon a time in Cloud Nagar, there lived a bright-eyed, bushy-tailed chaiwala named Chotu.
But Chotu wasnâ€™t just any tea-seller. He had a magical skill â€” he would appear only when someone shouted his name:
â€œChotu! Ek kadak cutting chai la re!â€
This isnâ€™t just a story â€” this is the perfect desi-style explanation of how AWS Lambda works behind the scenes.

So grab a chai â˜• and let's decode Lambda in the most unforgettable way!
Theka Lagao! (Provisioning Phase)



"Bina customer ke stove kyu jalaun bhai?"
Chotu doesn't light the stove until there's an order.

Similarly, AWS Lambda doesnâ€™t start running until â€¦
articles.title: â˜ï¸ AWS Lambda Ki Desi Kahani: Chotu the Serverless Superstar â˜•ðŸ’¥

articles.author: Abdelhakim mohamed
articles.description:
The Midnight Server Meltdown: What To Do When Your Backend Goes Silent
Imagine this: itâ€™s a peaceful night, maybe youâ€™re winding down, enjoying a movie, or catching up on some sleep. Suddenly, your phone rings it's your client or your boss. Their voice is urgent:
â€œThe server is down. Customers canâ€™t access anything. Everythingâ€™s super slow!â€
Your heart races. You scramble to your desk, half awake but fully alert now. You SSH into the server or open your monitoring dashboard nothing seems obviously broken. You check the logs theyâ€™re there, but not helpful. You hit a few endpoints they respondâ€¦ eventually. What used to take 200ms is now crawling at 10 seconds or, even worse, timing out.
At this point, panic is knocking on your door.
You start digging deeper. CPU usage is spiking, memory is bâ€¦
